item.title: Kurnool bus fire accident: Of 43 people on bus, 13 from Telangana and 12 from Andhra Pradesh
item.description:
<![CDATA[Of the 43 people on the private bus which met with a fire accident in Kurnool of Andhra Pradesh in the early hours of Friday (October 24, 2025), 13 were from Telangana, 12 from Andhra Pradesh and the remaining from other States, said Telangana’s Gadwal District Collector B.M. Santosh.
Of them, 23 passengers escaped. Bodies of 11 passengers were found, according to a communication from the Telangana Government at 9.45 a.m.
Medical teams recovered dead bodies and sent them to Government Hospital...]]>
item.author: Authors

item.title: Gadwal Collector, SP visit Kurnool bus accident site; helpline set up
item.description:
<![CDATA[Gadwal Collector, SP visit Kurnool bus accident site; helpline set up
Hyderabad, Oct. 24 -- As per directions of Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy, Jogulamba Gadwal District Collector B M Santosh, IAS, and District SP T Srinivasa Rao, IPS, on Friday visited the site of the tragic private travel bus accident at Chinnatekur in Kallur Mandal of Kurnool district, where several passengers lost their lives.
The officials personally inspected the accident site and discussed the situation wit...]]>

item.title: Gadwal Collector, SP visit Kurnool bus accident site; helpline set up
item.description:
<![CDATA[Gadwal Collector, SP visit Kurnool bus accident site; helpline set up
Hyderabad, Oct 24 (UNI) As per directions of Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy, Jogulamba Gadwal District Collector B M Santosh, IAS, and District SP T Srinivasa Rao, IPS, on Friday visited the site of the tragic private travel bus accident at Chinnatekur in Kallur Mandal of Kurnool district, where several passengers lost their lives.
The officials personally inspected the accident site and discussed the situation wit...]]>
item.author: Uniindia News Service
